newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba's Welteke - repo rate cut possible mid-term.
newsitem.headline: Buba's Welteke - repo rate cut possible mid-term.

text.p: Bundesbank council member Ernst Welteke said on Friday that a further cut in the German securities repurchase rate would be possible mid-term under certain circumstances.
Weltke told reporters while attending a conference that in the medium term "a repo rate cut is still possible depending on developments."

Welteke also sought to play down a comment made by Bundesbank chief economist Otmar Issing earlier this week that was widely interpreted by financial markets as indicating further German rate cuts were unlikely in the foreseeable future.
Welteke said he did not think Issing intended "with his little comment to take interest rate speculation out of the market for all time".
Issing had said on Wednesday in a television interview that key German rates were at a historic low and that "nothing more is expected or necessary".
While saying that rate cuts were still possible mid-term, Welteke nonetheless said that unless trends in key indicators changed, there was no reason to adjust rates.
